clusters.title: Japan set for first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins leadership race
clusters.neutral_headline: Japan Likely to Have First Female Prime Minister

items.title: Japan set for first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins leadership race
items.standfirst: Arch-conservative who models herself on Margaret Thatcher beats Shinjiro Koizumi in second-round party vote
items.content: Arch-conservative who models herself on Margaret Thatcher beats Shinjiro Koizumi in second-round party vote

items.title: Japan's ruling party elects Sanae Takaichi as leader, likely to become first female PM
items.standfirst: Japan's governing party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line ultra-conservative and China hawk, as its new leader, making her likely to become the country's first female prime minister.
items.content: Japan's governing party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line ultra-conservative and China hawk, as its new leader, making her likely to become the country's first female prime minister.(Image credit: Kim Kyung-Hoon)

items.title: Japan’s ruling party elects Sanae Takaichi as new leader, likely to become first female PM
items.standfirst: Sanae Takaichi, the newly elected and staunchly conservative head of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, is expected to become Japan's first woman prime minister. She won the leadership of Japan's ruling party on Saturday (October 4). James Simms, a journalist based in Tokyo, tells us more.
items.content: Sanae Takaichi, the newly elected and staunchly conservative head of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, is expected to become Japan's first woman prime minister. She won the leadership of Japan's ruling party on Saturday (October 4). James Simms, a journalist based in Tokyo, tells us more.

items.title: Japan poised to get first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
items.standfirst: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...

items.content: Arch-conservative who models herself on Margaret Thatcher beats Shinjiro Koizumi in second-round party vote

items.title: Sanae Takaichi poised to become first female Japanese PM after LDP leadership win
Japan’s Takaichi set to become country’s first female PM
Japan’s ruling party elects Takaichi, paving way for first woman prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader, positioning her to become the country’s first female prime minister. Takaichi, a former economic security minister, defeated Agriculture Minister Shinjiro Koizumi in a runoff vote, as the party seeks to recover from recent electoral losses and restore public trust.
items.content: Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader, positioning her to become the country’s first female prime minister. Takaichi, a former economic security minister, defeated Agriculture Minister Shinjiro Koizumi in a runoff vote, as the party seeks to recover from recent electoral losses and restore public trust.

items.title: Takaichi elected LDP leader, set to become Japan's next PM
items.standfirst: Sanae Takaichi was elected president of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), defeating Shinjiro Koizumi in a runoff vote with 185 to 156 votes. The victory positions the 64-year-old cons...
items.content: Sanae Takaichi was elected president of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), defeating Shinjiro Koizumi in a runoff vote with 185 to 156 votes. The victory positions the 64-year-old cons...

items.title: Sanae Takaichi set to become Japan's first female prime minister
items.standfirst: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.
items.content: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.

items.title: Japan’s LDP elects Takaichi as new leader, likely to be first female PM
items.standfirst: If elected, Takaichi will face a host of issues, including an ageing population and growing unease about immigration.
items.content: If elected, Takaichi will face a host of issues, including an ageing population and growing unease about immigration.

items.title: Japan is poised for its first-ever female prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan’s governing party elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader on Saturday, setting her up to become the U.S. ally’s first female prime minister.
items.content: Japan’s governing party elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader on Saturday, setting her up to become the U.S. ally’s first female prime minister.

items.title: Who are the candidates running to be Japan’s next prime minister?
items.standfirst: Japan's governing Liberal Democratic Party is choosing its next leader on Saturday.
items.content: Japan's governing Liberal Democratic Party is choosing its next leader on Saturday.

items.title: Japan may be about to make history with its next prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan could end up with its first female prime minister or its youngest leader in more than a century after a party leadership election on Saturday.
items.content: Japan could end up with its first female prime minister or its youngest leader in more than a century after a party leadership election on Saturday.

ai_summary: Sanae Takaichi won the leadership race of Japan's ruling party on Saturday.
She is an arch-conservative who admires Margaret Thatcher.
Takaichi defeated Shinjiro Koizumi in a second-round party vote.
Her victory makes her likely to become Japan's first female prime minister.
The US envoy congratulated Takaichi on her potential role as PM.

items.title: Hamas accepts some elements of Trump’s peace plan for Gaza, others require negotiation
items.standfirst: Israel launched dozens of air strikes and artillery attacks on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said Saturday (October 4), despite US President Donald Trump’s call to halt bombardments following Hamas's acceptance of some elements of his plan. Hamas said it was willing to release the hostages but that other aspects of the plan require further consultations among Palestinians.
items.content: Israel launched dozens of air strikes and artillery attacks on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said Saturday (October 4), despite US President Donald Trump’s call to halt bombardments following Hamas's acceptance of some elements of his plan. Hamas said it was willing to release the hostages but that other aspects of the plan require further consultations among Palestinians.

items.title: Live: Israel strikes Gaza after Hamas signals support for US-backed plan
items.standfirst: Israel launched dozens of air strikes and artillery attacks on Gaza City overnight, Gaza’s civil defence agency said Saturday, despite US President Donald Trump’s call to halt bombardments following Hamas's acceptance of some elements of his plan. At least 20 homes were destroyed, with multiple casualties reported, including children. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.

items.title: LIVE: Israel kills 20 people after Trump tells it to ‘stop bombing’ Gaza
items.standfirst: US leader tells Israel it 'must immediately stop' bombing Gaza, says he believes Hamas is 'ready for a lasting peace'.
items.content: US leader tells Israel it 'must immediately stop' bombing Gaza, says he believes Hamas is 'ready for a lasting peace'.

items.title: Trump orders Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas accepts peace plan
items.standfirst: Israel was on Friday ordered to stop bombing the Gaza Strip by US President Donald Trump after Hamas said it had accepted some of his plan to end the nearly two-year war in the Palestinian enclave. Hamas said that it was willing to release hostages, but that some elements of the plan needed further negotiations.
items.content: Israel was on Friday ordered to stop bombing the Gaza Strip by US President Donald Trump after Hamas said it had accepted some of his plan to end the nearly two-year war in the Palestinian enclave. Hamas said that it was willing to release hostages, but that some elements of the plan needed further negotiations.

items.title: Hamas agrees to release hostages under Trump's Gaza plan, other points need negotiating
items.standfirst: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.
items.content: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.

items.content: US president tells Israel to 'immediately stop bombing Gaza', says Hamas ready for 'lasting peace'.

items.title: Hamas agrees to release all Israeli hostages, conditions pending
items.standfirst: Hamas said it has agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, as long as “the field conditions for the exchange are met” and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Donald Trump’s plan for peace in the Middle East
items.content: Hamas said it has agreed to release all Israeli hostages, alive or dead, as long as “the field conditions for the exchange are met” and expressed willingness to negotiate through mediators on President Donald Trump’s plan for peace in the Middle East

Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. items.title: Hamas has sent out 'mixed messages' in response to Trump's peace plan
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump gave Palestinian Hamas militants until Sunday evening to accept his proposal to end the nearly two-year-old war with US ally Israel in the Gaza Strip. "There have been mixed messages from Hamas", said Noga Tarnopolsky, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. A Hamas military leader from Gaza said he opposed the deal, while the political leadership in Qatar said they wanted to look for gray areas, or places where a compromise could be reached, added Tarnopolsky.
items.content: US President Donald Trump gave Palestinian Hamas militants until Sunday evening to accept his proposal to end the nearly two-year-old war with US ally Israel in the Gaza Strip. "There have been mixed messages from Hamas", said Noga Tarnopolsky, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. A Hamas military leader from Gaza said he opposed the deal, while the political leadership in Qatar said they wanted to look for gray areas, or places where a compromise could be reached, added Tarnopolsky.

items.title: Egypt foreign minister urges Hamas to accept Trump Gaza plan and disarm
items.standfirst: Hamas reportedly split on response to deal as US president sets Sunday deadline for militant group to replyEgypt and Qatar are working to convince Hamas to accept Donald Trump’s ultimatum to end the war in Gaza, Egypt’s foreign minister has said, as Trump gave a Sunday deadline to reply.Badr Abdelatty said the time had come for Hamas to disarm, and that Israel should be given no excuse to continue its offensive in Gaza, where it killed another 28 Palestinians on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Hamas reportedly split on response to deal as US president sets Sunday deadline for militant group to replyEgypt and Qatar are working to convince Hamas to accept Donald Trump’s ultimatum to end the war in Gaza, Egypt’s foreign minister has said, as Trump gave a Sunday deadline to reply.Badr Abdelatty said the time had come for Hamas to disarm, and that Israel should be given no excuse to continue its offensive in Gaza, where it killed another 28 Palestinians on Friday. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Israel is preparing for immediate implementation of Trump's Gaza plan.
Trump ordered Israel to stop bombing Gaza immediately.
Hamas agreed to release hostages, but other aspects need negotiation.
Gaza residents reported scattered explosions despite the US order.
Turkey expects 36 citizens to return via a special flight.

clusters.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs: The Sentencing
clusters.neutral_headline: Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to over 4 years for prostitution-related charges

items.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs: The Sentencing
items.standfirst: A judge on Friday ordered Sean "Diddy" Combs to serve 50 months in prison — just over four years — for two prostitution-related charges. Combs was also given five years of supervised release and a $500,000 fine. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean Diddy Combs: The Sentencing," hosted by Jericka Duncan.
items.content: A judge on Friday ordered Sean "Diddy" Combs to serve 50 months in prison — just over four years — for two prostitution-related charges. Combs was also given five years of supervised release and a $500,000 fine. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean Diddy Combs: The Sentencing," hosted by Jericka Duncan.

items.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to over 4 years for prostitution-related charges
items.standfirst: Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing hearing was held three months after he was convicted ​on two prostitution-related charges.
items.content: Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing hearing was held three months after he was convicted ​on two prostitution-related charges.

items.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs: The Verdict
items.standfirst: A jury convicted Sean “Diddy” Combs on prostitution-related counts, but acquitted him of the more severe charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking on Wednesday, following a 7-week trial. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean 'Diddy' Combs: The Verdict," hosted by Jericka Duncan.
items.content: A jury convicted Sean “Diddy” Combs on prostitution-related counts, but acquitted him of the more severe charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking on Wednesday, following a 7-week trial. CBS News examines the high-profile federal trial in New York, the explosive testimonies, and what led to Comb’s arrest and federal charges in the one-hour special, "Sean 'Diddy' Combs: The Verdict," hosted by Jericka Duncan.

items.title: Musician Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced to four years in prison after apology
items.standfirst: The famed hip-hop mogul told the court that his actions were 'disgusting' and 'shameful' in a plea for leniency.
items.content: The famed hip-hop mogul told the court that his actions were 'disgusting' and 'shameful' in a plea for leniency.

items.title: 'I love you, I'm sorry': What Sean 'Diddy' Combs did the moment he learned his sentence
items.standfirst: It was a more subdued message from three months ago when Combs told his family he was "coming home".
items.content: It was a more subdued message from three months ago when Combs told his family he was "coming home".

items.title: Sean Combs sentenced to over four years in prison for prostitution-related charges
items.standfirst: Combs had been convicted in July on two counts of transportation for prostitution. During his sentencing hearing he spoke at length for the first time in the trial, addressing the judge at length.
items.content: Combs had been convicted in July on two counts of transportation for prostitution. During his sentencing hearing he spoke at length for the first time in the trial, addressing the judge at length.(Image credit: Jane Rosenberg)

items.title: Music mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to over 4 years in prostitution case
items.standfirst: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced Friday to four years and two months in federal prison after being convicted of organising drug-fueled, sometimes violent sex parties involving paid sex workers – a dramatic fall from grace for one of hip-hop's most powerful figures.
items.content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced Friday to four years and two months in federal prison after being convicted of organising drug-fueled, sometimes violent sex parties involving paid sex workers – a dramatic fall from grace for one of hip-hop's most powerful figures.

ai_summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced to 50 months in prison.
The sentence was for two prostitution-related charges.
He was also given five years of supervised release and a $500,000 fine.
Combs told the court his actions were "disgusting" and "shameful".
A jury acquitted him of more severe charges of racketeering and sex trafficking.

clusters.title: US government shutdown to drag into next week: Republicans, Democrats trade blame for breakdown
clusters.neutral_headline: US Government Shutdown Continues into Next Week

items.title: US government shutdown to drag into next week: Republicans, Democrats trade blame for breakdown
items.standfirst: Hopes for a quick end to the government shutdown faded Friday (October 3) as Democrats refused to budge in a Senate vote and President Donald Trump readied plans to unleash layoffs and cuts across the federal government. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Alison Sargent is joined by Richard Johnson, Lecturer in US Politics at Queen Mary University of London.
items.content: Hopes for a quick end to the government shutdown faded Friday (October 3) as Democrats refused to budge in a Senate vote and President Donald Trump readied plans to unleash layoffs and cuts across the federal government. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Alison Sargent is joined by Richard Johnson, Lecturer in US Politics at Queen Mary University of London.

clusters.title: Flights resume 'progressively' at Munich airport after second drone scare
clusters.neutral_headline: Munich Airport Experiences Second Drone-Related Closure

items.title: Flights resume 'progressively' at Munich airport after second drone scare
items.standfirst: Flights resumed "progressively" on Saturday (October 4) at Munich airport, but delays were expected after a drone scare caused a second shutdown in as many days, affecting over 6,500 passengers, the operator said.
items.content: Flights resumed "progressively" on Saturday (October 4) at Munich airport, but delays were expected after a drone scare caused a second shutdown in as many days, affecting over 6,500 passengers, the operator said.

items.standfirst: Flights were suspended for several hours on Friday night, with around 6,500 passengers affected.
items.content: Flights were suspended for several hours on Friday night, with around 6,500 passengers affected.

items.title: Drone sightings delay Saturday flight operations at Munich Airport
Munich airport forced to suspend flights for second day in a row over drone sightings
items.standfirst: About 6,500 passengers stranded as interior minister says earlier drone incident a ‘wake-up call’Munich airport was forced to halt operations for the second day in a row on Friday over drone sightings, with dozens of flights and more than 6,000 passengers affected.Airports in Denmark, Norway and Poland have recently suspended flights due to unidentified drones, while Romania and Estonia have pointed the finger at Russia, which has brushed off the allegations. Continue reading...

items.title: Munich airport grounded by drone sightings for second day running
items.standfirst: Munich airport was forced to suspend operations for a second consecutive day on Friday after drones were spotted near its runways, disrupting dozens of flights and leaving thousands of passengers stranded. The incidents come amid a wave of drone sightings across Europe, raising concerns about potential spillover from Russia’s war in Ukraine.
items.content: Munich airport was forced to suspend operations for a second consecutive day on Friday after drones were spotted near its runways, disrupting dozens of flights and leaving thousands of passengers stranded. The incidents come amid a wave of drone sightings across Europe, raising concerns about potential spillover from Russia’s war in Ukraine.

items.title: Munich airport reopens after drone sightings force closure
items.standfirst: Dozens of flights were cancelled or redirected at Munich International Airport after drone sightings.
items.content: Dozens of flights were cancelled or redirected at Munich International Airport after drone sightings.

ai_summary: Flights resumed at Munich airport "progressively" on Saturday.
A drone scare caused a second shutdown in as many days.
The incidents affected over 6,500 passengers.
Drone sightings have caused flight suspensions in other European countries.
The incidents raise concerns about potential spillover from the war in Ukraine.

items.title: Asahi cyberattack may leave beer fans high and dry
items.standfirst: Nothing ruins a buzz like a ransomware attack. Japan is on the verge of running out of its most popular beer, Asahi Super Dry, after Asahi announced on Monday that a cyberattack caused its systems to fail. Days later, Japan’s biggest brewery is still experiencing disruptions in its shipping and…

items.title: Cyberattack could leave Japan without its most popular beer
items.standfirst: Japan could soon be running out of Asahi, the East Asian nation’s most popular beer, following a devastating cyberattack Monday that has brought its factories to a halt.
items.content: Japan could soon be running out of Asahi, the East Asian nation’s most popular beer, following a devastating cyberattack Monday that has brought its factories to a halt.

items.title: Japan days away from running out of Asahi Super Dry due to cyber attack – reports
items.standfirst: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry. clusters.title: Death toll rises to 14 in Indonesia school collapse, dozens still missing

items.title: Death toll rises to 14 in Indonesia school collapse, dozens still missing
items.standfirst: The death toll from a boarding school collapse in Indonesia rose to 14 on Saturday, as rescuers deployed heavy machinery to search for dozens of people still missing. The multi-storey building collapsed during afternoon prayers on Monday, with experts citing possible substandard construction.

items.title: Indonesian school collapse: death toll rises to 14 as crews pull more bodies from rubble
items.standfirst: Dozens of students remain unaccounted for at Sidoarjo boarding school as rescuers bring in heavy excavators to clear large slabs of concreteThe death toll from a school collapse in Indonesia rose to 14 on Friday after recovery crews pulled multiple bodies from beneath the rubble. Dozens of students remain unaccounted for and the death toll is expected to rise.Rescuers initially searched by hand for survivors after the building caved in on Monday. But with no more signs of life detected by Thursday, they turned to heavy excavators equipped with jackhammers to help them progress more rapidly. Continue reading...

But with no more signs of life detected by Thursday, they turned to heavy excavators equipped with jackhammers to help them progress more rapidly. Continue reading...

Heavy machinery is being used to clear the rubble.

clusters.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
clusters.neutral_headline: Treasure Hunters Discover $1M in Silver and Gold Coins

items.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
items.standfirst: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...

Continue reading...
